questions.question: 1. In which stage, the creep rate is constant?

answers.d: It is not constant in all the three stages

questions.question: 2. In which of the following tests load is generally kept constant?

3. It is given that aluminium can creep at and above 0.4 T_m, where T_m has its usual meaning. Calculate the minimum temperature (in oC) at which aluminium can creep? Melting point of aluminum is 660 oC
4. What is/are true for Stage III (tertiary stage) of creep?

answers.a: The strain rate is the minimum in this stage
answers.b: This stage is of shorter duration than secondary stage
answers.c: The material deforms with a continuously decreasing creep rate
answers.d: The strain hardening rate balances the recovery rate

questions.question: 5. In which stage the effect of strain hardening is more than softening?

answers.d: Strain hardening is never higher in any stage
